730791f-a.title: Bridges - Hell Gate Bridge - [East River.]
730791f-a.text:
The newest bridge across the East River, New York City
This 1,000 foot span, the longest arch in the world, is over
the dangerous channel at Hell Gate. Long Island City (a part of
greater New York) is on the rifht of the picture, with werdts
Island on the left. The structure turns, crosses the island,
passes over water again to Randall's Island and finally raeches
the mainland in the Borough of the Bronx. Jt is wholly a rail-
road bridge, part of a six mile road connecting the Pennsylvania
and New Haven Systems and permitting through freight and passenger
sorvice betwean New England and the Sodth. The structure was
formally dedicated on ~arch 9, tpok four years to build and
cost 127,O00,00O. lIt makes the fifth bridhe across the East River
all axcept the Brooklyn Bridge have been opened in the last
twelve years.
April, 1917 Amuerican Press Assn.
730791f-a.folder: Hell Gate Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730797f-a.title: Bridges - Hell Gate Bridge - [Bronx - Queensborough.]
730797f-a.text:
Hell Gate Bridge, showing the approach from the Bronx, spanning Ward's
Island, with the Queensborough end at the right. The bridge is the rail
link between the Penn. R.R. Terminal in Manhattan and the New England lines.
The main span of the Bridge is 1016 ft. long and 300 ft. above high water
mark. The cost of the bridge wasJ25,O00,O00.
About 1930.
Ewing Galloway.
730797f-a.folder: Hell Gate Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730813f-b.title: Bridges - Hell Gate Bridge - [The bridge begins at Port Norris, Bronx, spanning Ward's and Randall's Islands, to Astoria, Queens.]
730813f-b.text:
(1)
Hell Gate Bridge spans the notorious channel, called Hell Gate; at
the convergance of Long Island Sound and the East River. The seething
whirlpools and conflicting currents, made it extremely unnavigable; sink-
ing many vessels, and drowning innumerable men: hence the name. The
bridge begins at Port Morris in the Bronx, spanning Ward's and Randall's
Islands, to Astoria in Queens. It is one of the classics of modern
achievement, being the world's longest continued span. The eastern
railway tnterests combined to build it, and completed it in 1917.
July 25, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
730813f-b.folder: Hell Gate Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730813f-a.title: Bridges - Hell Gate Bridge - [The bridge begins at Port Norris, Bronx, spanning Ward's and Randall's Islands, to Astoria, Queens.]
730813f-a.text:

ing many vessels, and drowning innumerable men: hence the name. The
bridge begins at Port Morris in the Bronx, spanning Ward's and Randall's
Islands, to Astoria in Queens. It is one of the classics of modern
achievement, being the world's longest continued span. The eastern
railway tnterests combined to build it, and completed it in 1917.
July 25, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
730813f-a.folder: Hell Gate Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730816f.title: Bridges - Hell Gate Bridge [New York Connecting Railroad Bridge.]

The New York Connscting Railway Bridme (Hellgate Bridge) as
photographed southwestward from Astoria. Wards Island provides a
base for the underpinning shown.
1939
Alexander Alland
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume
"Portrait of N. Y.' by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.

Rell Gate Bridge, showing Astoria Park in Queens, while under construction.
June 11, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(e)
Crowds enjoying the swimmuing pool in Astoria Park.
July 17, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A similar view to No. 2, from a slightly different angle.
July 17, 1936.
